editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: F-150v: Psalter. F-129v 151 Psalms of David. The word for God is rubricated. The midpoint is unmarked. The spiritual meaning of the Hebrew letters in Psalm 118 is from the new common system. Psalm 151 is the long version. F-143r: Biblical Canticles. The fourth canticle is "Prayer of Hana, mother of Samuel, prophet." F-150r: Song of Songs, common edition. F-160r: Praises of Mary, arranged for the days of the week: Monday (150v), Tuesday (151v), Wednesday (153r-155r), Thursday (155r), Friday (157r), Saturday (158r), Sunday (159r). F-164r: Gate of Light. Ornamental designs, f, 10r, 18r, 26r, 36v, 45r, 51r, 60v, 72v, 73r, 82r, 88r, 101v, 114r, 117r, 123r, 130r, 143r. The colophons and/or final notes on have all been deleted and are illegible, except that the manuscript was once owned by certain Sahayu. (With info from Macomber Catalogue).

extent.measure: ff. 164; 1 col (ff. 3r-150r) and 2 cols (ff. 150r-163v); 20 lines (ff. 3-151) and 22 to 26 lines (ff. 152-163)

revisionDesc.change: Created XML record from EMIP Collection Metadata.xsls
